Photonic Compute In Memory (PCIM) is a pioneering AI computing approach that breaks traditional memory bottlenecks by integrating computation directly within photonic memory layers, using light pulses for data processing. This technology leverages wavelength parallelism—multiplexing 96 distinct data channels simultaneously through a single waveguide—enabling ultrafast, energy-efficient, and parallel computations at the speed of light with minimal heat generation. Using advanced materials like ReRAM and PCM for training and inference, PCIM achieves 20× higher compute density and 15× better energy efficiency compared to GPUs. It employs differential time encoding of light pulses for high precision and stability impervious to temperature and aging, promising transformative impacts on AI hardware through reduced energy consumption, high yield manufacturing, and enhanced reliability.

We have successfully built our Minimum Viable Product (MVP) and have completed product validation, proving the effectiveness of our solution. As we move forward, we are dedicated to increasing the accuracy of our model to 99%, with the support of expert guidance and strategic investment. At Rakta Cure, we are driven by a commitment to healthcare innovation. Our vision is to bridge the gap in early cancer detection and empower healthcare professionals with the tools they need to combat cancer efficiently. By combining advanced AI with clinical insights, we aim to make early-stage diagnosis quick, reliable, and affordable for all.
